intro: Trixis chionopappa, commonly known as the white-flowered trixis, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided leaves and small, white or pale yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in alpine or subalpine habitats, preferring well-drained soils and full sun exposure. Trixis chionopappa is sometimes cultivated for its ornamental value due to its delicate appearance and ability to thrive in cooler climates.
